Keywords: Asgardian , Brute , Deity , Future , Monster , Mystical , Past
Real Name: Loki Laufeyson
Special Powers
I WISH...I WISH...: Steal Energy. // When Loki hits, after resolutions give each hit character an action token.
I COULDN'T POSSIBLY TELL YOU, IT'LL RUIN THE MAGIC: Plasticity. // Adjacent opposing characters can only clear one action token instead of two.

superbill7
Pretty sure he's meant to be played with Party Thor from the same set. Add the Darcy Lewis from the same set and you have a 150 point tie up synergy team that allows for some silly token "gifting" shenanigans. Throw in another 150 points of sniper/snipers and it can get REALLY brutal.

Disasstah
This guy + First Born are going to be a nasty base to a Mystics team. The common Winter Soldier for this set would only add to the pain.
June 1, 2022
reanimationguy
I don’t see in what world this fig’s powers aren’t synergetic with each other. The only thing is the knockback from quake, which you can choose to not do. Goop is off the goop.
June 1, 2022
BroVoodoo
Goop coming in hot with the clown comment as usual. Synergy. the interaction or cooperation of two or more organizations, substances, or other agents to produce a combined effect greater than the sum of their separate effects. Giant Reach, Charge, and Quake that also hands out action tokens don’t have synergy??? Plasticity, Flurry, and Steal Energy that hands out tokens don’t have synergy??? On top of all that, adjacent characters only clear one action token at a time? All the clicks on this dial absolutely have synergy between the powers from click to click.
May 27, 2022
Goop
I think we have a different definition of what synergy is, i assume it to be powers/abilities that work together. Example: Flurry + Steal Energy. Not independent powers that work in different situations. Thats what you have here with this Loki. I would call that versatility like kevbot stated above. I'm not a fan of charge + ESD but someone might call that versatile too. I'm not saying this loki is bad, i'm just saying some of his powers dont necessarily compliment each other well..
May 16, 2022
hoojeebo
Referencing the Steal Energy rule change from like 4 years ago? Oh geez. That's not relevant to a piece that was designed for today's game. It sounds to me like you think "having Great Size" in general is a liability, which is a pretty basic blanket stance to take, and which I disagree with since that's just one side of the story. More characters can see him, but so can he see more characters! Add in Colossal Willpower and 66% of the time he's pulling off his own tokens so that he can continue giving them out. More often than not these days, I'm not using the knockback that Quake provides anyway. Knockback is mainly for positioning now, and if I don't have an overwhelming need to do so, my general priority in using Quake is to attack clusters of enemies over pushing them somewhere. And I definitely wouldn't want them pushed away from me when I have a really good reason to keep them right next to me anyway! The value of a piece is not in being able to use every single power that a figure has in every situation, but in them having options, and a potential to "switch gears", and with this piece you can push or "hold pieces close" as the game-state dictates, which I think is rad.
May 16, 2022
kevbot333
Loki DOES have awesome synergy. Not only that, but he gives you options. Need to take on a swarm? Get close, quake, and limit actions. Need to take on a beat stick? Keep your distance and hit with full damage. His perplex is very versatile as well. He can use it on himself, but he can also use on anyone within range on an outdoor map. Giant size willpower is one of the best abilities in the game. It ensures that Loki can use his steal energy as many times as possible.
May 16, 2022
Goop
Actually i see some uneven synergy with him, quake + steal energy is not as great as it once was now only healing for one. Also he needs to be adjacent to figures for plasticity and limiting their clearing which means you often can't really utilize his giant reach or knockback for attacks. He's not a bad piece he just has a few problems is all.
May 15, 2022
hoojeebo
Yeah, you DO want to be Quaking with him because he gives action tokens to every figure hit, plus he's good against a swarm because then adjacent opposing figures only clear one action token. Hit him, take a Mystics, then he can heal up with Steal Energy. The synergy on this guy is crazy good.
May 15, 2022
Goop
He's good but do you really want to be quaking when you can do 4 damage on your top click? He has some options and is good for his points, not sure if he's really chase worthy but he's a solid attacker. Seems kinda easy to kill, especially being a giant you can hit him from anywhere on an outside map.
